channel.title: Powerpoint on a website?
channel.description:
ok i am doing a class project, so i though it would be nice to present it to the class via website rather the board and chalk method.
so i got a flash site up and running, now i want to put on a powerpoint, is there a way i can have a powerpoint on a website and operate it. (what i mean is that i press next and it goes to the next slide)

item.title: Powerpoint on a website?
item.dc:creator: @SETO SETO
item.description:
@SETO wrote:

thanks guys but found a solution, i just converted the power point into a flash file, that’s it it runs fine on the site and the user is able to control it.

Read full topic

item.title: Powerpoint on a website?
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

Unhandled:

Use Google Docs!

this.

Read full topic

item.title: Powerpoint on a website?
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

I’m fairly confident you can embed a powerpoint slideshow in an ActiveX control and use IE to display it. However that’s fucking stupid.

Use Google Docs!

Read full topic

item.title: Powerpoint on a website?
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

probably not,

what you can do, however, is grab each frame of the presentation (via whatever application you want), and manage to go to the next frame using javascript, unless you want to use all the additional features ms powerpoint provide (ie effects, etc)

Read full topic
